title: Capital: Volume 1
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx magnum opus analyzing the capitalist mode of production, introducing concepts of surplus value, commodity fetishism, and the labor theory of value.

title: The Communist Manifesto
author: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels
description: The foundational text of modern communism, outlining class struggle, the nature of capitalism, and the goals of communist revolution.

title: Wage Labour and Capital
author: Karl Marx
description: An accessible introduction to Marx economic theories, explaining the relationship between labor and capital.

title: The German Ideology
author: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels
description: Develops historical materialism and critiques German idealist philosophy.

title: Grundrisse
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx notebooks outlining his critique of political economy, containing important discussions of automation and human development.

title: State and Revolution
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin theory of the state as an instrument of class rule and the necessity of its eventual withering away.

title: Imperialism, the Highest Stage of Capitalism
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Analysis of imperialism as monopoly capitalism, explaining colonial exploitation and inter-imperialist rivalry.

title: What Is To Be Done?
author: Vladimir Lenin
description: Lenin argument for a disciplined vanguard party to lead the working class.

title: Reform or Revolution
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg polemic against Eduard Bernstein revisionism, arguing that reforms cannot transform capitalism.

title: The Accumulation of Capital
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Luxemburg major economic work analyzing capitalism need for non-capitalist markets.

title: The Mass Strike
author: Rosa Luxemburg
description: Analysis of the 1905 Russian Revolution and the role of mass strikes in revolutionary struggle.

title: Prison Notebooks
author: Antonio Gramsci
description: Gramsci brilliant writings on hegemony, civil society, intellectuals, and revolutionary strategy.

title: The Conquest of Bread
author: Peter Kropotkin
description: Kropotkin vision of anarchist communism, arguing for the abolition of private property and wage labor.

title: Mutual Aid: A Factor of Evolution
author: Peter Kropotkin
description: Kropotkin scientific argument that cooperation, not competition, is the primary factor in evolution.

title: God and the State
author: Mikhail Bakunin
description: Bakunin fierce critique of religion and the state as twin pillars of oppression.

title: Anarchism and Other Essays
author: Emma Goldman
description: Goldman essays on anarchism, women liberation, free love, and social struggle.

title: Living My Life
author: Emma Goldman
description: Goldman epic autobiography covering her life as an anarchist agitator.

title: The Wretched of the Earth
author: Frantz Fanon
description: Fanon searing analysis of colonialism and decolonization. Essential anti-colonial text.

title: Black Skin, White Masks
author: Frantz Fanon
description: Fanon psychological study of the effects of colonialism and racism on Black consciousness.

title: How Europe Underdeveloped Africa
author: Walter Rodney
description: Rodney Marxist analysis of how European colonialism systematically underdeveloped Africa.

title: Pedagogy of the Oppressed
author: Paulo Freire
description: Freire revolutionary approach to education as liberation, critiquing banking education.

title: Discourse on Colonialism
author: Aime Cesaire
description: Cesaire poetic and devastating critique of European colonialism.

title: Guerrilla Warfare
author: Che Guevara
description: Guevara manual on guerrilla warfare based on the Cuban Revolution experience.

title: The Motorcycle Diaries
author: Che Guevara
description: Guevara journal of his youthful journey across South America.

title: The Origin of the Family, Private Property and the State
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Engels analysis of how the family and women oppression arose with private property.

title: Woman, Race and Class
author: Angela Davis
description: Davis groundbreaking analysis of the intersection of gender, race, and class.

title: Are Prisons Obsolete?
author: Angela Davis
description: Davis argument for prison abolition, tracing the prison-industrial complex roots in slavery.

title: Caliban and the Witch
author: Silvia Federici
description: Federici analysis of the witch hunts as primitive accumulation.

title: The Second Sex
author: Simone de Beauvoir
description: De Beauvoir foundational feminist text analyzing women oppression.

title: Black Reconstruction in America
author: W.E.B. Du Bois
description: Du Bois Marxist reinterpretation of Reconstruction, centering Black agency.

title: The Souls of Black Folk
author: W.E.B. Du Bois
description: Du Bois classic essays on race in America, introducing double consciousness.

title: Black Marxism
author: Cedric Robinson
description: Robinson analysis of the Black radical tradition. Introduces racial capitalism.

title: The Autobiography of Malcolm X
author: Malcolm X with Alex Haley
description: Malcolm X powerful life story, from street hustler to revolutionary internationalist.

title: Revolutionary Suicide
author: Huey P. Newton
description: Black Panther Party co-founder autobiography and political philosophy.

title: Assata: An Autobiography
author: Assata Shakur
description: Black Liberation Army member account of her political awakening and escape to Cuba.

title: The Black Jacobins
author: C.L.R. James
description: James classic history of the Haitian Revolution and Toussaint Louverture.

title: History and Class Consciousness
author: Gyorgy Lukacs
description: Lukacs influential work introducing reification and totality to Marxist theory.

title: One-Dimensional Man
author: Herbert Marcuse
description: Marcuse critique of advanced industrial society and how it contains opposition.

title: Eros and Civilization
author: Herbert Marcuse
description: Marcuse synthesis of Marx and Freud, envisioning a non-repressive civilization.

title: Dialectic of Enlightenment
author: Theodor Adorno and Max Horkheimer
description: Frankfurt School critique of instrumental reason and the culture industry.

title: Minima Moralia
author: Theodor Adorno
description: Adorno aphoristic reflections on damaged life under late capitalism.

title: Capitalist Realism
author: Mark Fisher
description: Fisher analysis of how capitalism colonizes the imagination, making alternatives unthinkable.

title: The Shock Doctrine
author: Naomi Klein
description: Klein expose of how disaster capitalism exploits crises to impose neoliberal policies.

title: This Changes Everything: Capitalism vs. The Climate
author: Naomi Klein
description: Klein argument that addressing climate change requires challenging capitalism itself.

title: A People History of the United States
author: Howard Zinn
description: Zinn landmark history from the perspective of workers, slaves, immigrants, and women.

title: Debt: The First 5,000 Years
author: David Graeber
description: Graeber anthropological history of debt, challenging economic orthodoxy.

title: Bullshit Jobs
author: David Graeber
description: Graeber analysis of pointless work under capitalism.

title: The New Jim Crow
author: Michelle Alexander
description: Alexander analysis of mass incarceration as a new system of racial control.

title: The Great Transformation
author: Karl Polanyi
description: Polanyi analysis of the market economy as a historical aberration.

title: Late Capitalism
author: Ernest Mandel
description: Mandel comprehensive Marxist analysis of postwar capitalism.

title: A Brief History of Neoliberalism
author: David Harvey
description: Harvey accessible account of neoliberalism rise and its devastating effects.

title: The Limits to Capital
author: David Harvey
description: Harvey comprehensive reading of Marx Capital with attention to geography.

title: The Making of the English Working Class
author: E.P. Thompson
description: Thompson monumental history of working-class formation in England.

title: Labor and Monopoly Capital
author: Harry Braverman
description: Braverman analysis of the degradation of work under monopoly capitalism.

title: Strike!
author: Jeremy Brecher
description: Brecher history of mass strikes in America, emphasizing rank-and-file militancy.

title: The Ecology of Freedom
author: Murray Bookchin
description: Bookchin synthesis of anarchism and ecology. Foundation of social ecology.

title: Less Is More
author: Jason Hickel
description: Hickel argument for degrowth as the only way to address climate change.

title: The Divide
author: Jason Hickel
description: Hickel analysis of global inequality as a product of colonialism and neoliberalism.

title: Society of the Spectacle
author: Guy Debord
description: Debord Situationist critique of consumer society. Influenced May 1968.

title: The Revolution of Everyday Life
author: Raoul Vaneigem
description: Vaneigem passionate call for transforming daily life.

title: The Jungle
author: Upton Sinclair
description: Sinclair muckraking novel exposing conditions in the meatpacking industry.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: Steinbeck epic of the Joad family during the Great Depression.

author: George Orwell
description: Orwell dystopian novel warning against totalitarianism.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: Orwell allegorical critique of the Russian Revolution betrayal.

title: Homage to Catalonia
author: George Orwell
description: Orwell memoir of fighting with the POUM militia in the Spanish Civil War.

title: The Dispossessed
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: Le Guin anarchist utopia exploring the tensions between freedom and solidarity.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: Le Guin groundbreaking exploration of gender and society.

title: The Jakarta Method
author: Vincent Bevins
description: Bevins account of US-backed anti-communist mass killings in Indonesia. Essential Cold War history.

title: Half-Earth Socialism
author: Troy Vettese and Drew Pendergrass
description: A utopian vision combining ecological rewilding with socialist planning.

title: Abolition Geography
author: Ruth Wilson Gilmore
description: Collection of Gilmore essays on prison abolition and racial capitalism.

title: Freedom Dreams
author: Robin D.G. Kelley
description: Kelley exploration of Black radical imagination and visionary politics.

title: Democracy for the Few
author: Michael Parenti
description: Parenti critique of American democracy as serving elite interests.

title: Blackshirts and Reds
author: Michael Parenti
description: Parenti defense of actually existing socialism and critique of liberal anti-communism.

title: The History of the Russian Revolution
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky magisterial history of 1917, combining vivid narrative with Marxist analysis.

title: The Revolution Betrayed
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky Marxist analysis of Stalinist degeneration and the Soviet bureaucracy.

title: Permanent Revolution
author: Leon Trotsky
description: Trotsky theory of permanent revolution, arguing socialist revolution must spread internationally.

title: The Civil War in France
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx analysis of the Paris Commune, the first workers government.

title: The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte
author: Karl Marx
description: Marx brilliant analysis of Louis Bonaparte coup, history repeating as tragedy then farce.

title: Socialism: Utopian and Scientific
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Engels accessible summary of the development of socialist thought.

title: Anti-Duhring
author: Friedrich Engels
description: Engels comprehensive defense of Marxism covering philosophy, political economy, and socialism.

title: Ten Days That Shook the World
author: John Reed
description: Reed eyewitness account of the Russian Revolution. Vivid journalism from inside the revolution.

title: Why Marx Was Right
author: Terry Eagleton
description: Eagleton systematically refutes the most common objections to Marxism with wit and clarity.

title: The Rights of Man
author: Thomas Paine
description: Paine defense of the French Revolution and argument for natural rights.

title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
author: Mary Wollstonecraft
description: Wollstonecraft foundational feminist text arguing for women education and equality.

title: Racecraft
author: Karen E. Fields and Barbara J. Fields
description: Analysis of race as ideology rather than biology, comparing racial thinking to witchcraft.

title: Capital: Volume 2
author: Karl Marx
description: Analysis of the circulation process of capital.

title: Capital: Volume 3
author: Karl Marx
description: The process of capitalist production as a whole.

title: Critique of the Gotha Programme
author: Karl Marx
description: Critique of social democratic reformism.

author: Karl Marx

title: Theories of Surplus Value

description: Critical history of economic thought.
